dataList.content: <This room...>
What... is with that look on thy faces?
Thou standest in the audience of the prince. Where are thy obsequious smiles?
He... must be the Bloodfiend who caused this outbreak. He is our target.
Fall to thy knees and grovel before royalty!
... Who the hell are you to make those demands?
I shall impart this upon thee only once, so listen well.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Thou mayest address me as Prince Cassetti, the Sixth Kindred, or a Kindred of the sixth generation, the rightful prince in refuge from his Family!
Art thou the villain... who hath brought such destruction and massacre upon this vessel?

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Thou art a chatty one, so rudely before your prince. Yet I am feeling generous, for I am quite sated at the moment.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: As thou must have seen on thy journey here... this place is a hall of banquet for a feast most majestic.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: No matter how many Bloodbags I create, no matter how much I devour them... the humans just won't stop coming! I only enjoy what was cast into my maw!
... He dons a mask for the purpose of merrymaking.
If we're really going to exchange pleasantries, why don't you take that mask off? Or are you unfamiliar with the basic etiquette?

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Oh, this... this mask!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Won't come off. Can't take it off. Shouldn't take it off! There's no prince without the mask!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: We're so, so ugly behind the mask; so we all decided hide how repulsive we've become. But once I've drunk your blood full, then it'll all go back to how it used to be. Only then can I unmask myself...
Who stitched that mask to your face skin? Not a half-bad job.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Of course it's excellent! Ha ha! Because this mask was crafted by none other than the great and the eminent Barber, whose name I dare not even speak! But... but it hurts so much...!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: No, no! I'm smiling! Look, look how hard I'm smiling and laughing! HAHAHA! HA! HAAA... YES, I AM THE PRINCE, THAT'S WHAT I AM!
He's a bloody loon, innit?
All right, done with the giggles, then? Get ready for the beating of your life.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: I... I enjoy things like you and your friends.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Don't cry, bawling and bowing and sniveling on the ground for your lives!...

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Lunge at me instead, hm?! The aggression, the boiling blood, oh, how I love the fire!
What are you, daft? Look around. There are thirteen of us and only one of you.
Do not let your guard down, Heathcliff. This entity has managed to turn countless passengers of this train into his Bloodbags.
I ain't letting my guard down. But... we blasted through so many Bloodbags we couldn't even keep count, didn't we?

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Couldn't even keep count...? Oh no, no... but the count is so important! I have to keep count of our visitors! Oh yes, of course! I do remember to keep count of our dearest visitors! Yessir I do!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: You have no idea how powerful I am. And I shall not relinquish my throne to thee from this budding kingdom!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: All I have to do is sit here and do nothing, and the Bloodbags present themselves before me! There's no paradise like this out there... you have no idea what I did to create this place!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Ohh, how elated my forebearer Kindreds would be, should they be here to witness what I have created! This cornucopia of abundance... this pleasure... o, this freedom...!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: But this kingdom is mine! I made it! I'm not giving it away, nope!
This is rather curious.
It appears that this Bloodfiend leaves this car only on rare occasions...
... Yet we have seen signs of his insidious influence throughout every car we have visited so far.
Then what he meant by how "the Bloodbags present themselves" before him has to be...

dataList.title: MultiCrack Office
dataList.content: HOLD ON A MINUTE!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: GYAH!!!
A figure suddenly and frantically charged into this car.
It was Sasha, the Fixer we ran into in one of the earlier cars.
Cassetti shrinks into his throne at the sudden burst, terror apparent in his face.
Ah, it is thee! By the— hast thou truly journeyed here to assist us in our quest?!
Lo! That villain is the Bloodfiend responsible for the tragedies that have transpired aboard this train!
Help us slay that cur and eventually lead the passengers thou hast protected thus far out of this train!
Bloodfiends...
... What if there was more than a single Bloodfiend on board, one still capable of rational thought...

dataList.title: MultiCrack Office
dataList.content: Damn, you actually made it all the way back here? I guess the Wings don't give out contracts to just anyone.

dataList.title: MultiCrack Office
dataList.content: I... I used to fight to my damnest, too. 'Till I was the last one standing...
What's she talking about?

dataList.title: MultiCrack Office
dataList.content: But where did that leave me? In the end, I stood alone with nothing but a single one of these four arms left.

dataList.title: MultiCrack Office
dataList.content: Kinda funny how the perspective on life can just completely flip when you're really, really in the shit. I think my last thoughts were...

dataList.title: MultiCrack Office
dataList.content: "Man... I... don't wanna die..."

dataList.title: MultiCrack Office
dataList.content: So I fell on my knees and pleaded. I told him that...
Don Quixote, watch out!

dataList.title: MultiCrack Office
dataList.content: ... I'd do anything to live.
Blood rapidly crystallized around Sasha like a suit of armor as she swung her greatsword at the Sinners, striking them even before Faust finished her sentence.
... Agh!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Wha...

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: ... What did I say?! I commanded you to give me a warning before jumping in like that!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Don't you know how loud your stupid arms are? I thought the Family had come for me!

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: I'm sorry, Lord Cassetti.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Ah... allow me to introduce my Kindred to thee, to be the first of many since my escape, for the kingdom I intend to build.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: My Kindred, my loyal squire... who shall be at my side as I build a dynasty of my own, my Family...

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Lord Cassetti, I had intended to select the more powerful of the bunch to send to this car, as you have commanded me, but... the humans in my car were all weaklings. So I present before you this group from the first class car.
Kindred...
Are you even aware of the exact nature of a 'Kindred'?

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Nah, but I can tell ya this.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: When I accepted my lord's blood into my veins... it was as though I was reborn.
I see. A Bloodfiend's Kindred is like a sub-entity of the Bloodfiend, similar in concept to sub-entities created by Distortions or Abnormalities.
It must have been desperation that drove you to accept that proposition without hesitation, despite the lack of relevant information.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Maybe. That's... probably what was going through my head before I became a Kindred.
Thou hast been in cohorts with this villain... all this time? As his lackey?
Even ere then, when we first laid our eyes upon thee...?

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Lady, you have no idea how much I freaked out when one of you asked me something about 'red eyes'. Not that it would've mattered if you did suspect me though, since my red eye is just a prosthetic.
T-then... the passengers who were under thy protection...

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Haven't I told you... that the count matters?

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: The longer the line... the better.

dataList.title: Bloodbag
dataList.content: Ksshhh...

Dozens of Bloodbags began shambling into the room from behind Sasha.
... A smaller one among them stood out to me.
... My mind immediately snapped to the child who grabbed Don Quixote's coattails.
I knew that the passengers were dead the moment we realized Sasha was a Bloodfiend. But this... I really, really hoped that I wouldn't have to face this reality. Not like this.
There was... a child...

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Yep. Little runt wanted to be a Fixer if she got to grow up.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Good thing she won't, though. I can tell you on good authority that 'living' as a Bloodbag is way better than the drudgery that is the life of a Fixer. Believe me, I'd know.
... Hold thy vile tongue.

dataList.title: Bloodfiend
dataList.content: Dreaming of becoming a famous, respected Fixer? An enactor of justice? It's all just a stupid pipe dream that always ends in crushing disappointment. Or a really, really early grave.
Silence... SILENCE!
Don Quixote did not give Sasha time to finish her sentence; she was already charging full-speed at her with her lance drawn.
